intro: Hieracium praefoliatum, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to yellow ray florets. Hieracium praefoliatum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
